com.powerup.logic

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.powerup.logic.Board

  • public final class Board
extends Object
    Responsible for maintaining the game's tiles.
    Since:
    2014-01-22
    Author:
    Oliver Lewisohn

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Creates 100 tiles and picks five of them to be played at the start.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Creates 100 tiles and picks five of them to be played at the start.

    • Method Detail

      • playStartingTiles

        public void playStartingTiles()
        Plays five tiles to start the game off.

        This method may be deprecated in future, as each player will draw one initial tile, with the player drawing closest to A0 going first.

      • chooseNewPlayableTiles

        public void chooseNewPlayableTiles(int n)
        Allocates a number of new playable tiles.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of new tiles to be allocated.

      • getTiles

        public ArrayList<ArrayList<Tile>> getTiles()

      • getPlayableTiles

        public ArrayList<Tile> getPlayableTiles()

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(int x,
           int y)

      • playTile

        public boolean playTile(int x,
               int y)
        Plays a tile to the board.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the tile to be played.
        y - The y-coordinate of the tile to be played.
        Returns:
        True if the tile was able to be played, false otherwise.

      • getNeighbours

        public ArrayList<Tile> getNeighbours(Tile tile)
        Finds which neighbouring tiles of a given tile have been played.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile whose neighbours are to be fetched.
        Returns:
        A list containing the played neighbours of the parameter tile.
